content:
• Monday, November 21, 2016
  • GTE

    Gran Tierra Energy to sell 43.3M shares in bought deal offering

    • Gran Tierra Energy (NYSEMKT:GTE) -5.3% AH after announcing plans to sell more than 43.3M shares on a bought deal basis at $3/share, with an underwriters option to purchase up to another 6.5M-plus common shares; if the over-allotment option is exercised in full, gross proceeds from the offering would total nearly $150M.
    • GTE says it plans to use the proceeds to repay borrowings outstanding under its revolving credit facility.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 27 Comments
  • PFPT

    Proofpoint, FireEye, Fortinet, CyberArk Software down after hours subsequent Palo Alto Networks Q1 reporting

    • Proofpoint's (NASDAQ:PFPT) at present lower by nearly 4%, FireEye (NASDAQ:FEYE) and Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) 2%, and CyberArk Software (NASDAQ:CYBR) 1.15%.
    • Names in the sector unchanged include Check Point Software Technologies, Imperva, Symantec, Barracuda Networks and VASCO Data Security International, though trading in both Check Point Software Technologies and Barracuda Networks is relatively active.
    • Earlier: Palo Alto Networks -13.8%; Q1 actual, Q2 guide off revenue expectations
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: SBLK +9.3%. ENTA +3.1%. SINA +3.0%. WLL +2.3%. CLMT +2.2%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: PANW -11.8%. DY -9.6%. BECN -7.6%. PNNT -7.5%. VIPS -7.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 9 Comments
  • CTIC

    CTI BioPharma perks up on presentation announcement

    • In a late-breaking oral presentation at the American Society of Hematology annual meeting Dec. 3-6, CTI BioPharma (NASDAQ:CTIC) will disclose data from its Phase 3 PERSIST-2 trial for comparing the investigational agent pacritinib, an oral multikinase inhibitor, with physician-specified best available therapy, including ruxolitinib, for treatment of patients with myelofibrosis whose baseline platelet counts are less than 100,000 per microliter.
    • Share are higher by 15% in thin after hours action.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • RIGP

    Transocean improves acquisition offer for Transocean Partners

    • Transocean Partners (NYSE:RIGP) +6.8% AH after Transocean (NYSE:RIG) says it will increase to 1.2 shares from 1.1427 the consideration for its pending acquisition of each RIGP common unit it does not already own.
    • The move follows the recent failure to receive 50.1% of shareholder votes necessary to approve the RIG-RIGP merger.
    • RIG expects to issue ~23.8M shares in the merger.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • BFAM

    Bright Horizons insiders cash in some stock

    • The company announces a secondary offering of 2M shares from selling shareholders. Bright Horizons (NYSE:BFAM) will receive no proceeds.
    • Shares -1.9% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • HPP

    Hudson Pacific lower as Blackstone sells more

    • The secondary size is 18.7M shares, and consists of 17.5M shares offered by Hudson Pacific (NYSE:HPP) and 1.17M shares by Farallon Capital Management.
    • Proceeds will be used to buy back 17.25M units in the operating partnership mostly being offered by Blackstone.
    • After the deal, Blackstone will own about 11.8% of the company, and Farallon 1%.
    • HPP down 2.2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • PNNT

    PennantPark tumbles after rough quarter, dividend cut

    • Noting continued weakness in energy and "overall yield compression in the market," PennantPark (NASDAQ:PNNT) says it will pay out the expected $0.28 per share this quarter, but then cut the dividend to $0.18 beginning in the March quarter.
    • Management will extend its 16% waiver of base and incentive fees through the end of next year.
    • Previously: PennantPark Investment misses by $0.05 (Nov. 21)
    • Shares -10% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 17 Comments
  • WB

    Weibo beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Weibo (NASDAQ:WB): Q3 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $176.9M (+41.8% Y/Y) beats by $3.83M.
    • Shares +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • BDGE

    Capital raise for Bridge Bancorp

    • The Bridgehampton lender is using the occasion of the recent run-up in its stock price to sell some shares - about $50M worth, with an underwriter greenshoe of up to another 15% of the number sold.
    • The underwriters are Sandler O'Neill and KBW.
    • BDGE -1.9% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks -13.8%; Q1 actual, Q2 guide off revenue expectations

    • Results – revenue $398.1M (+34% Y/Y, $2.1M below estimates), EPS $0.55 ($0.02 above estimates), net income $51.2M (vs. $30.8M Y/Y), cash flow from operations $203.3M (+39% Y/Y), free cash flow $182.4M (+43% Y/Y),
    • Highlight metrics – billings $516.9M (+33% Y/Y), deferred revenue $1.4B (+69% Y/Y), 1,500 new customers added
    • Q2 projections – revenue $426M-$432M (+27%-29% Y/Y increase) [consensus $438.88M], EPS $0.61-$0.63 (consensus $0.63)
    • Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) CEO Mark McLaughlin: "Our first quarter 2017 results underscore that our Next-Generation Security Platform uniquely solves customers' most complex security challenges. Our platform's ability to provide high degrees of prevention, automation, leverage and consistent security, regardless of wherever data may be, is becoming increasingly important in the face of today's important macro technology changes. As a result, customers and prospects globally are adopting our platform at high rates."
    • Prior quarters overview
    • Conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 6 Comments
  • JACK

    Jack In The Box beats by $0.15, revenue in-line

    • Jack In The Box (NASDAQ:JACK): FQ4 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $398.42M (+12.5% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Shares +1.35%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • FCX

    Landslide kills 13 as illegal diggers invade Freeport's Temke mine in Congo

    • A landslide killed at least 13 people last week in the Democratic Republic of Congo after thousands of artisanal miners began invading Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +5.6%) Temke copper mine, according to the Lualaba provincial governor.
    • Between 5K-10K illegal miners have descended on the Tenke copper mine, one of the world's largest, in the past week for reasons that are not entirely clear.
    • Tens of thousands of people in the area depend on small-scale mining to support their families and often operate within the perimeters of industrial mines, using rudimentary tools, sometimes resulting in deadly accidents.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 19 Comments
  • SYMC

    S&P Global rates Symantec BBB-, places on CreditWatch with negative implications following LifeLock acquisition

    • Attributed to Symantec's (SYMC +3.2%) planned funding of its $2.3B buyout of LifeLock with $1.5B of balance sheet cash and $750M of incremental debt.
    • S&P Global Ratings expects increased debt and lower levels of cash to bring adjusted leverage to more than 4x at transaction finalization and to remain greater than 3x for 12-24 months subsequent that point.
    • A more than two-notch downgrade is considered unlikely.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • GLOP

    GasLog Partners started at Buy, Teekay LNG Partners at Hold by Stifel

    • GasLog Partners (GLOP +2%) is initiated at Buy with a $24 price target at Stifel, which believes the marine MLP is well positioned for growth given a strong backlog of dropdown candidates at the sponsor levels and the strengthening fundamentals of the liquefied natural gas market.
    • The firm expects GLOP distributions to grow by at least 10%/year for the next several years and thinks units are attractively valued, trading at a 9.7% yield.
    • Stifel also initiates Teekay LNG Partners (TGP +3.5%) with a Hold rating and $14.50 price target, believing that TGP can now refocus on absorbing built-in growth now that it has largely refinanced and recapitalized the business.
    • But the firm says several loans remain to be refinanced and several vessels are not earning their full contracted rates, thus distribution growth likely will be gradual and back-end loaded for 2018 and 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 34 Comments
  • DIS

    Disney tripped up after report of Amazon live sports interest

    • Disney (NYSE:DIS) moved lower after The Wall Street Journal reported that Amazon is in talks with professional sports leagues about live rights for games.
    • Sources say the company is considering a premium sports package tied to its Prime program.
    • Nothing definitive has been established yet by the Seattle e-commerce giant.
    • Shares of Disney were down over 1% initially after the news broke before recovering back.
    • Previously: Amazon considered to be exploring live sports Prime package (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 10 Comments
  • SXL

    Energy Transfer simplification means 8% declines for SXL, ETP; ETE +3%

    • Both Sunoco Logistics Partners (SXL -7.8%) and Energy Transfer Partners (ETP -7.9%) trade sharply lower on news of the plan for the much smaller SXL to purchase ETP that will result in a net implicit reduction in distribution yield for ETP unitholders.
    • ETP investors will receive 1.5 units of SXL for each unit of ETP they own but their payouts will be reduced since SXL has a much lower dividend yield; CreditSights says the merger amounts to a “stealth distribution cut” that reduces the ETP cash payout by 29%.
    • Bernstein Research notes CEO Kelcy Warren chose a path that protects Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +2.8%), the entity in the group of companies in which he holds more than 10% of shares outstanding.
    • But analysts generally are pleased that the deal - if it is approved by unitholders - will simplify ETE's complex structure, which also includes Sunoco LP (SUN -3.6%) and PennTex Midstream Partners (PTXP +0.8%); Baird analyst Ethan Bellamy calls the deal "a major step in untangling... the most complex web of publicly traded partnerships."
    • Seaport Global's Sunil Sibal calculates that the deal will lead to a distribution reduction of ~$1.22 per ETP unit, or $650M, but could turn out well in the long run, lowering the cost of capital through the Energy Transfer complex and positioning it for acquisitions as the industry continues to consolidate.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 43 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: MVIS +15%. LOCK +15%. OTC:MDSY +15%. AMCC +11%. FSNN +10%.
    • Losers: MSDI -11%. SCON -11%. CUB -10%. SITO -9%. LIVE -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments

  • Oil perky on hopes for output deal

    • The latest chatter on some sort of agreement comes from Libyan OPEC Governor Mohamed Oun, who says the cartel is discussing an output range of 32.5M-33M barrels per day (vs. current levels just north of 35M).
    • OPEC meets to maybe hammer out a formal deal later this month.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • WTI crude today is higher by 3.9% to $47.48 per barrel - now up about $4 per barrel over the past few sessions.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWTI, UCO, DWTI, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, OILK, OILX
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 5 Comments
  • AZO

    Auto parts stores rally after Credit Suisse says trends line up favorably

    • AutoZone (AZO +2.9%) is rallying after Credit Suisse calls it the "top way to play" the improved outlook for the auto parts sector.
    • CS thinks weather will reaccelerate growth over the next few months on top of some other macro headwinds for the sector.
    • Advance Auto Parts (AAP +2.9%), O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY +1.7%) and Genuine Parts (GPC +1.8%) are also higher on the day.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • AR

    Antero Resources, Rice Energy rise to Buy from Hold at Deutsche Bank

    • Antero Resources (AR +1.7%) and Rice Energy (RICE +5.2%) are both upgraded to Buy from Hold at Deutsche Bank, which sees the companies as having the potential to generate “consistent growth across two high quality asset bases with good entry points for investors."
    • Deutsche Bank believes AR is one of the best positioned producers, given its growth, hedge book and asset base, and says the company largely insulated in 2017 with gas hedges in place.
    • The firm likes Rice's integrated business model and management’s disciplined approach to consolidation.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • ANET

    Arista Networks +7.5%, EOS ruled outside scope of ITC limited exclusion order

    • By the U.S. Customs and Border Protection, effectively lifting restrictions on import of associated products to the United States. The ITC, though, is noted to remain unbound by the CBP decision and that the ruling could be modified or revoked should errors or other conflict with future findings be determined.
    • Subsequent analyst reaction – Arista Networks (NYSE:ANET) target raised from $84 to $95 (current price $94.54) at RBC Capital Markets (Sector Perform) and from $93 to $110 at BMO Capital Markets (Outperform).
    • Previously (August 23) – Cisco: Trade Representative upholds import ban on Arista Networks
    • Previously (June 23) – ITC upholds Cisco victory in Arista patent case; ANET -3.8%
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • MNST

    Beverage stocks setting the pace in consumer goods sector

    • Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) is up 4.51% on a huge volume move.
    • Other beverage stocks with a head of steam include National Beverage Corporation (FIZZ +4.2%), Boston Beer (SAM +2.2%), Molson Coors (TAP +1.9%), Dr Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD +1.8%) and Jones Soda (OTC:JSDA +2.8%). Leading Brands (LBIX-OLD +12.1%) moved higher after a bullish Seeking Alpha article went live.
    • It's not clear why the names are attracting so much attention today from investors (M&A intrigue?), but as a group beverage stocks are the top performer in the consumer goods sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: CHNR +40%. NADL +17%. LLEX +16%. ORIG +15%. RCON +13%.
    • Losers: KGJI -21%. FSI -11%. URRE -9%. ETP -9%. GSV -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • ARA

    Goldman negative on American Renal; shares down 9%

    • Thinly traded American Renal Associates (ARA -8.6%) slumps on slightly higher volume pressured by Goldman Sachs' downgrade to Sell from Neutral. Analyst Matthew Borsch cites the company's decision to temporarily suspend certain assistance for charitable premium support as a "key risk" to its pricing and earnings growth. Despite the cloudy outlook, he raised the price target to $22 (0%) upside from $20.
    • Competitor DaVita (DVA +2%) suspended its premium support activities several weeks ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • RNR

    RenaissanceRe slips as Deutsche takes profits

    • The stock is "no longer attractive as a new money investment," says analyst Joshua Shanker following a 16% rise YTD, with most of that in the last couple of months.
    • Even with the strong move of late, large-cap P&C names have underperformed other financials, and this could continue as rising interest rates may mean more difficult pricing and mark-to-market fixed-income losses.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • RNR -0.75% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • AGLE

    Aeglea Bio's AEB3103 shows encouraging anti-tumor action in preclinical studies; big up move wilts

    • Thinly traded nano cap Aeglea BioTherapeutics (AGLE +1.4%) was up almost 80% but failed to hold onto the gain. The action was apparently stoked by positive results from preclinical studies assessing AEB3103 in prostate cancer and breast cancer models. The data were published online today in Nature Medicine.
    • AEB3103 is an engineered human enzyme that targets the degradation of the amino acid cysteine/cystine. The company says that no native human cysteine/cystine-degrading enzyme has been identified (until now).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • FNBC

    First NBC on the move on reported deal discussions

    • According to DealReporter, First NBC (OTC:FNBC +15.1%) is in talks with two possible buyers - namely "prime contenders" Iberiabank (IBKC -1.1%) and Hancock Holding (HBHC -0.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM

  • 'Cheap' fixed-income ETFs get Barron's boost

    • The sharp selloff in fixed-income not only may have gone too far, suggests Andrew Bary, noting a 10-year Treasury yield of 2.33% already discounts plenty of things that may happen in the coming months (or may not happen).
    • Whether rates are too high or not is up for argument, but what isn't are the discounts to NAV on at least a few closed-end funds.
    • Those mentioned: Nuveen AMT-Free Quality Municipal Income (NEA +1.5%), BlackRock Municipal 2030 Target Term Trust (BTT +0.9%), BlackRock Taxable Municipal Bond Trust (BBN +1.5%), Nuveen Preferred Income Opportunities (JPC +2.2%).
    • Also noted is a mutual fund which has sold off: Vanguard Intermediate-Term Tax-Exempt Fund (MUTF:VWIUX).
    • Another way to play is in preferred stock, with issues from Wells Fargo, Bank of America, and Public Storage all mentioned, or the iShares Preferred Stock ETF (PFF +0.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • CEMP

    Cempra off 8% as bulls dwindle

    • Cempra (CEMP -7.9%) bulls among analysts just lost one of their own. Cowen and Company's Ritu Baral just downgraded the stock to Market Perform citing the lack of clarity with lead product candidate solithromycin.
    • Since the close 7-6 Ad Comm vote several weeks ago, there have been a rash of downgrades. According to MarketBeat, there are three Buy ratings on the stock and eight Hold/Underweight ratings. Before the Ad Comm, 10 of 11 analysts rated the stock a Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 30 Comments
  • KITE

    Wainwright likes Kite Pharma, see 45% upside

    • H.C. Wainwright initiates coverage of Kite Pharma (KITE +3.6%) with a Buy rating and $78 (45% upside) price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: MN +7%. OTC:FNBC +6%. BSBR +6%. LFC +5%. NRT +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • KGJI

    Kingold Jewelry stung by fraud accusation

    • In an Instablog post, Seeking Alpha contributor Aurelius calls Kingold Jewelry (KGJI -16.7%) a "fraud school" success story with documents showing the typical reverse takeover mix of fabricated SEC filings, false statements, and related party transactions.
    • He notes the company appears to be poised to launch another U.S. capital raise, despite mulling a potential buyback earlier this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 53 Comments
  • MVIS

    MicroVision +16%, license agreement struck with Taiwanese ODM

    • To make and sell laser beam scanning engines. MicroVision to receive royalties for each engine sold. The development is related to the company's newly formed collaboration with STMicroelectronics, made known earlier this month.
    • MicroVision (NASDAQ:MVIS) shares are presently trading higher by 19.40% on a 5-day term, 38.35% on the month and 4% over the last three.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: RXII +44%. CHNR +36%. ALBO +28%. MIRN +26%. HW +17%. EYEG +17%. TK +16%. MVIS +15%. LOCK +15%. OTC:MDSY +15%.
    • Losers: GLBS -18%. ADVM -15%. TSN -14%. DRYS -14%. SGNL -14%. KGJI -14%. SINO -13%. TOPS -12%. RLOG -12%. LIFE -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • BSBR

    Large- and mid-cap stocks making 52-week highs/lows on unusual volume

    • 52-week highs on 3x or more normal volume:
    • Banco Santander Brasil (BSBR +5.8%) - now up 120% YTD
    • Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +3.4%) - Energy Transfer Partners being acquired
    • Arista Networks (ANET +6.1%)
    • Hillenbrand (HI +1.3%)
    • International Game Technology (IGT -4.3%) - strong results, but now reversing
    • Lexmark International (LXK +0.5%)
    • 52-week lows on just modestly higher than normal volume:
    • CubeSmart (CUBE -0.9%)
    • Extra Space Storage (EXR -0.9%)
    • PLDT (PHI -1.9%)
    • 58.com (WUBA -1%)
    • Infosys (INFY)
    • Novo Nordisk (NVO -0.5%)
    • Grupo Televisa (TV -0.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar -8% as Q3 solar shipments miss company guidance

    • Canadian Solar (CSIQ -8.1%) is sharply lower after reporting in-line Q3 earnings on a 22% Y/Y drop in revenues to below company guidance, attributed to the dislocation of the global solar market during the quarter and the quarter-end logistic disruption caused by the bankruptcy of Hanjin Shipping.
    • CSIQ says its Q3 solar module shipments totaled 1,185 MW, of which 1,161 MW was recognized in revenue, compared to 1,290 MW recognized in revenue in Q2 and company guidance of 1,200-1,300 MW.
    • Q3 gross margin was 17.8%, vs. 17.2% in Q2 and company guidance of 14%-16%.
    • For Q4, CSIQ expects total solar module shipments of 1.4-1.5 GW, total revenues of $600M-$750M, and gross margin of 11%-16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 21 Comments
  • ALBO

    Albireo adds to A4250-stoked up move; shares ahead 41%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Albireo Pharma (ALBO +41.2%) heads north on almost a 7x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 190K. Shares have rallied 145% since November 15 when the company announced that the European Medicines Agency designated lead product candidate, Phase 2-stage A4250, for its PRIME program for the treatment of progressive familial intrahepatic cholestasis (PFIC).
    • EMA's PRIME, which provides for the accelerated review of the marketing application, is akin to the FDA's Fast Track.
    • A4250 is a selective inhibitor of the ileal bile acid transporter (IBAT), a therapeutic target for constipation-associated diseases.
    • Albireo Pharma is the product of the May merger between Biodel and Albireo Limited.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM

  • Consumer Goods - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: OTC:FENX +8%. ZX +7%. KNDI +5%.
    • Losers: TSN -14%. CRWS -8%. LTEA -6%. LFVN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras to get back $60M in corruption probe

    • Brazilian prosecutors in the Operation Car Wash corruption probe say Petrobras (PBR +4.3%) will receive another 204M reais ($60.4M) retrieved from politicians and companies who agreed to cooperation in the investigation.
    • The payment is the result of plea deals struck by prosecutors with politicians, and is in addition to more than 500M reais (~$150M) in compensation PBR already has received.
    • Separately, PBR says an injunction in a civil lawsuit has forced it to suspend the sale of stakes in the Baúna and Tartaruga Verde oil fields to Australia's Karoon Gas; it says it plans to appeal the decisions.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • EPIX

    ESSA Pharma nabs $10M capital raise; shares down 11%

    • ESSA Pharma (EPIX -10.8%) secures a $10M term loan facility from Silicon Valley Bank (SVB). It can drawn down $8M initially followed by $2M subject to conditions. The interest rate is Wall Street Journal Prime Rate + 3.0%.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, ESSA will issue warrants to SVB to purchase stock valued at 4% of the amount borrowed.
    • Proceeds will fund working capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • NE

    Noble Corp. names Tudor Pickering's Peakes as new CFO

    • Noble Corp. (NE +3.5%) names Adam Peakes as its new CFO, effective Jan. 23.
    • Peakes has served as managing director and head of OFS investment banking at Tudor Pickering Holt since 2011 after serving in various roles at Goldman Sachs during 2000-11, most recently as managing director of global natural resources in the investment banking division.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 8 Comments
  • MLCO

    Fresh 52-week high for Melco Crown amid favorable trend

    • Melco Crown (MPEL +3.3%) reached a 52-week high of $19.45 this morning as investors keep betting on the company's potential in China, and perhaps even in Japan in the long term.
    • Earlier, Credit Suisse boosted its rating on MPEL to Outperform from Neutral. There was also a huge sectorwide call from CS when it raised it forecast for 2017 Macau casino revenue to +16% growth vs. +8% prior forecast.
    • Previously: Casino operators watch Japan for green light (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • POST

    Post-earnings analysis on Post Holdings

    • Wells Fargo backs Post Holdings (POST +3.7%) as a Top Pick after factoring in FQ4 results and guidance.
    • The potential for outperformance with the Michaels business and a bright outlook on cereal underpin the Wells enthusiasm on the food stock.
    • The investment firm moves it valuation range on POST to $102-$103 from $95-$96.
    • Goldman sticks with Buy rating and lifts its price target to $97 on its view that underlying EBITDA generation is strong.
    • Stifel Nicolaus trimmed its PT on Post to $85 from $95.
    • There's a more cautious view on Post from SA contributor The Value Investor.
    • Sources: Bloomberg and MarketBeat.com.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • SVRA

    Mast Therapeutics mulling reverse merger; shares up 16%

    • Mast Therapeutics (MSTX +16.2%) reports that its evaluation of strategic alternatives includes a possible reverse merger with a privately-held firm. It says it has received several written indications of interest from companies with synergistic clinical-stage product candidates.
    • It is also exploring ways to monetize ifs vepoloxamer assets, including licensing deals.
    • Shares cratered in September after vepoloxamer flunked a late-stage study in sickle cell disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 27 Comments
  • BP

    Reuters: BP restricts CEO Dudley in Iran decision-making

    • BP (BP +2.1%) has created a new executive committee to explore business in Iran which will exclude its American CEO Bob Dudley to avoid potential violations of U.S. sanctions still in place, Reuters reports.
    • The new committee is headed by CFO and British national Brian Gilvary, who will coordinate BP's operations in Iran and any discussions with the country's national oil company, according to the report.
    • BP has yet to sign any deals with Iran, and a lack of clarity over Iran's terms for new production contracts, difficulties facing the banking system due to continued U.S. sanctions, and companies' severe budget constraints due to lower oil prices have kept most oil majors on the sidelines.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 25 Comments
  • LIFE

    aTyr Pharma secures $20M capital raise from Silicon Valley Bank; shares off 9%

    • aTyr Pharma (LIFE -9.3%) closes a $20M term loan facility with Silicon Valley Bank (SVB). The first tranche of $10M was funded on last Friday. Two additional tranches of $5M each may be drawn down later subject to conditions.
    • In connection with the loan, the company issues warrants to SVB to purchase common shares equal to 3% of the loan value.
    • A portion ($2.6M) of the $10M tranche was used to repay the balance of a prior loan with SVB.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Thinly traded nano cap Oragenics (OGEN +18.6%) heads north on increased volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has designated lead product candidate, Phase 2-stage AG013, for Fast Track review for the treatment of oral mucositis.

  • SXL

    Sunoco Logistics to acquire Energy Transfer Partners

    • Sunoco Logistics Partners (SXL -1.6%) agrees to acquire Energy Transfer Partners (ETP -1%) in a unit-for-unit transaction.
    • ETP unitholders will receive 1.5 common units of SXL for each common unit of ETP they own, which equates to a 10% premium to the volume weighted average pricing of ETP’s common units for the last 30 trading days.
    • The companies say the combined partnership will offer increased scale and diversification across multiple producing basins and have greater opportunities to more closely integrate SXL's natural gas liquids business with ETP's natural gas gathering, processing and transportation business; the companies also anticipate more than $200M/year in commercial synergies and costs savings by 2019.
    • Kelcy Warren, Chairman of parent company Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +10%), will be CEO of the combined company; ETE will continue to provide all incentive distribution right subsidies that are currently in effect for both partnerships.

    • Results from the Zuma-1 study showed Kite Pharma's (NASDAQ:KITE) lead product candidate KTE-C19 produced a 76% response rate in patients with certain types of blood cancer who failed to respond to chemotherapy and 80% in those who relapsed after stem cell transplantation.   • CXO

    Concho buys New Mexico acreage for ~$430M, raises production guidance

    • Concho Resources (NYSE:CXO) +2.6% premarket after agreeing to acquire ~16.4K net acres in the northern Delaware Basin in New Mexico for ~$430M in cash and stock, and raising its FY 2017 production guidance.
    • CXO says it will issue 2.18M shares and pay $150M in cash, funded with cash on hand and borrowing from its credit facility as well as potential asset sales.
    • The deal includes ~2.5K boe/day (69% oil) of current production, and expands its position in the Red Hills area by more than 25% to ~47K net acres.
    • As a result of the acquisition, CXO says it plans to increase its operated rig count to an average of eight rigs in the northern Delaware Basin during 2017, and now expects to grow oil production volumes by more than 20% Y/Y in 2017 and total production by 18%-21%, up from prior guidance of 17%-20%.
    • CXO also maintains its 2017 capex guidance of $1.4B-$1.6B.

  • OMER

    Omeros completes study of OMIDRIA in children; regulatory application to follow; shares up 1% premarket

    • Per the FDA's post-marketing requirement for OMIDRIA (phenylephrine and ketorolac injection) Omeros (NASDAQ:OMER) announces the completion of a clinical study assessing the safety of the cataract surgery medicine in children. The trial enrolled ~70 pediatric patients (newborn to age three) undergoing cataract surgery, a rare condition in children.
    • OMIDRIA was shown to be safe and well-tolerated with the incidence of adverse events consistent with those observed in pediatric cataract surgery.
    • The company will submit a supplemental NDA (sNDA) promptly. The agency has agreed that the results can be extrapolated to patients through 18 years of age.
    • The completed study fulfills Omeros' post-marketing commitment and extends OMIDRIA's marketing exclusivity for an additional six months. The FDA approved it in June 2014 to maintain pupil diameter in adults undergoing cataract surgery.
    • Shares are up 1% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM | 3 Comments
